availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hampton P. Welborn (Muhlenberg County, Kentucky farmer, minister, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky farmer, minister, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Elisabeth A. Welborn. Father of Letitia A. Welborn, Louisa E. Welborn, Mahala H. Welborn, Mary A. Welborn, and Malissa E. Welborn. Baptist minister in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Farmer and Justice of the Peace in Muhlenberg County in 1863.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 28; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 1; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Muhlenberg County, KY, July 1863, p. 31, (Accessed via ancestry.com); Find A Grave, "Rev Hampton P Wellborn (1821-1865)," Memorial #5733307, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin//fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=5733307 (accessed May 31, 2017); KYR-0001-029-0506.
